incidents.name: Customers Unexpectedly Redirected to Twilio Login Page

incident_updates.body: Our Engineering team has determined that this issue does not have a major impact for customers and will be continuing to investigate and remediate the full root cause. If customers experience errors, we recommend that they try to clear cookies and retry to log in.

We are still investigating a service interruption where customers may experience being unexpectedly redirected to the Twilio Console login page. This experience may impact new user signups as well as existing customers with established sessions within the Twilio Console. We expect to provide another update in 16 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We are still investigating a service interruption where customers may experience being unexpectedly redirected to the Twilio Console login page. This experience may impact new user signups as well as existing customers with established sessions within the Twilio Console. We expect to provide another update in 8 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We expect to provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We are investigating a service interruption where customers may experience being unexpectedly redirected to the Twilio Console login page. This experience may impact new user signups as well as existing customers with established sessions within the Twilio Console. incidents.name: SMS Delivery Delays to Orange Network in Congo

incident_updates.body: Twilio SMS was degraded for 290 minutes between 02:50 PST and 07:40 Pacific Time on 01/17/2025. During this period of time, customers may have experienced SMS delivery delays to the Orange network in Congo. The issue has now been resolved.

Our engineers are currently investigating the customer impact of a retroactive issue causing SMS delivery delays to the Orange network in Congo. We will provide an update with customer impact details within the next two hours.

incidents.name: Content Template Builder Functionality Disruption

incident_updates.body: Template creation was degraded for 5 hours and 17 minutes between 09:01AM and 02:18PM Pacific Time on January 16th/2025. During this period of time, customers experienced 400 errors while trying to create templates through Console Builder UI. The issue has now been resolved.

Our engineers are currently investigating the customer impact of a retroactive issue with Content Editor Template Creation Functionality Broken. We will follow up and provide customer impact details within 2 hours.

incidents.name: Customers Unable to Access New Account Creation and MFA Reset Pages in Console

incident_updates.body: We have identified the root cause of the issue preventing some customers from accessing pages within the Twilio Console to self-serve creation of additional accounts and reset their MFA enrolment. We are working with our vendor partner to resolve the issue. We recommend that any customer using Chrome as the browser to log in retry using Edge as the browser. We expect to provide another update in 24 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

During this period of time customers may have experienced Delayed SMS/MMS Delivery to T-Mobile Numbers when sent from Long Codes, Short Codes and Toll-Free Senders. The issue has now been resolved.

incidents.name: Call Failures to a subset of Twilio Singapore Phone Numbers

We are observing recovery in SMS delivery when sending messages to Surf Telecom network in Brazil. We will continue monitoring the service to ensure a full recovery. We will provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We are still experiencing SMS delivery delays when sending messages to Surf Telecom network in Brazil. Our engineers are working with our carrier partner to resolve the issue. We will provide another update in 4 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We continue experiencing SMS delivery delays when sending messages to Surf Telecom network in Brazil. Our engineers are working with our carrier partner to resolve the issue. We will provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We are experiencing SMS delivery delays when sending messages to Surf Telecom network in Brazil. Our engineers are working with our carrier partner to resolve the issue. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: AT&T US API Errors Impacting Account Security Services

incident_updates.body: The issue affecting AT&T US API with impact on Account Security Services has been resolved; the service is functioning normally at this time.

We are still experiencing an issue with AT&T US API, impacting Account Security Services, causing Verify SNA down for AT&T apart from VERIFY tag is now operating normally. We will continue to monitor for system stability. We'll provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We are still experiencing an issue with the AT&T US API, impacting Account Security Services, causing Verify SNA down for AT&T apart from VERIFY tag. Our engineering team is actively working to resolve the issue. We expect to provide another update in 8 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We continue experiencing an issue with the AT&T US API, impacting Account Security Services. Our engineering team is actively working to resolve the issue. We expect to provide another update in 4 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We continue experiencing an issue with the AT&T US API, impacting Account Security Services. Our engineering team is actively working to resolve the issue. We expect to provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We are experiencing an issue with the AT&T US API, impacting Account Security Services. Our engineering team is actively working to resolve the issue. We expect to provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Inbound Call Failures to a Subset of Twilio Numbers From Multiple Coutries

incident_updates.body: The issue affecting inbound calls to Twilio phone numbers from multiple countries has been resolved, and the service is functioning normally at this time.

We have started seeing recovery for inbound calls to Twilio phone numbers from multiple countries. We will continue to monitor to ensure a full recovery. We expect to provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We continue observing a subset of call failures to Twilio phone numbers from multiple countries. We are currently working with our carrier partners to resolve the issue. We expect to provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.
